instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> Burnt
threads.message:
Hi 
I got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Motherboard for No Power
<CHIP>U3210</CHIP> was burnt badly from top So I replaced it also <CAPACITOR>C3285</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C3286</CAPACITOR> had Liquid Damage, Both replaced. 
Still board is not powering up 
Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 3.32V

Don't know where to start now

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> Burnt
threads.message:
Check for any short on power rails of Thunderbolt area.

Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> at same time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> Burnt
threads.message:
I did trigger <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR> by Shorting both points
I checked all Pins on <CAPACITOR>C3210</CAPACITOR> nothing is low on resistance rest of the board in Mint condition, didn't find any short on power rails in thunderbold area

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> Burnt
threads.message: Can I bypass thunderbolt Area since originally it was burnt, definitely something is short in that area but I couldn't figure out

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <CHIP>U3210</CHIP> Burnt
threads.message:
